tweet: Did you know I'm on Instagram? Be sure to follow along as I fight for Maryland and maybe even take a few selfies!  https://www.instagram.com/repdavidtrone/

Thank you @RepAnnaEshoo for being a champion on Energy & Commerce on the intersection of opioids and mental health. I look forward to working together to increase access to mental health resources for those with substance use disorder.

With these programs, people with disabilities can more fully participate in education, employment, and their communities. Thank you to our participants for sharing their stories and expertise with me!
I'll soon be introducing the 21st Century Assistive Technology Act which will increase access to assistive technology devices and services and improve funding for these programs in rural areas.

AT is an item, service, or program that helps enhance learning, working, and daily living for persons with disabilities. AT can include everything from communication boards and prosthetics to keyboards and curriculum aids.

At our Assistive Technology (AT) Roundtable, I heard from constituents, researchers, and community leaders about the impact assistive technology has on the lives of people with disabilities and their caretakers. pic.twitter.com/U12aovYinP

Many already face restrictions to reproductive health services. This Frederick clinic serves patients in Maryland, Virginia, West Virginia, and Pennsylvania because patients lack access to care in their communities.
Because of this new rule, Planned Parenthood has been forced out of Title X, which threatens access to birth control and reproductive health care for millions of people across the country.
